title: (x) Conservation Corps of long Beach - Bernhard Gothic {Raph}
content: At first I thought this was Serif Gothic (I believe it has the tiny serifs, but it's hard to tell from this scan from an old business card), but the different style lower case "a" among other things says it's something else. Any ideas? ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224934im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/48476.gif)
author: alexdad

comments.content: [Nobel](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-nobel/nobel-regular/testdrive.html?s=Conservation+Corps&p=48) is quite close but lacks the distinctive B among other features.

[Bernhard Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/bernhard-gothic-sg/bernhard-gothic-medium-sg-regular/testdrive.html?s=Conservation+Corps+of+Long+Beach&p=36). Of the revivals I looked at on myfonts, the Spiece Graphics was the most accurate, but the E+F is decent too.

Hey, Bernhard Gothic it is.   
Thanks everyone.
